title: Pedro unhappy at Chelsea and considering future after being axed by Frank Lampard
text:
The Spanish winger did not even make the bench in Chelsea’s last outing (Picture: Getty)

Chelsea winger Pedro is reportedly growing increasingly unhappy at the west London club after losing his place both in Frank Lampard’s starting XI and even the matchday squad.

After starting the first two games of the season against Manchester United and Leicester City, the World Cup winner has only played in one of the subsequent six Premier League games.

The likes of Mason Mount and Willian have been preferred by Lampard, while the return to fitness of Callum Hudson-Odoi has increased competition even more.

Hudson-Odoi and Pulisic are ahead of Pedro in Lampard’s pecking order (Picture: Getty)

In Chelsea’s last outing before the international break, away at Southampton, there was not even room for Pedro in the squad, with Hudson-Odoi starting and Christian Pulisic on the bench.

According to Spanish newspaper Sport, Pedro is not enjoying his current predicament and is no longer ‘feeling good’ in England.

The 32-year-old’s issues are two-fold, losing his place in the team while his former partner and three children have all returned to Spain.

Pedro is enduring one of the most troubling periods of his career and is no longer enjoying his time at Stamford Bridge, which could prompt him to seek a move away.

Lampard has made a notable shift away from Chelsea’s experienced veterans since taking charge, promoting the club’s emerging crop of talented academy products.

Pedro has been training at Cobham during the international break (Picture: Getty)

Pedro’s form is also an issue, having not scored a Premier League goal since February.

So far this season, the Spaniard has only managed to score or assist against League Two side Grimsby Town in the Carabao Cup, firing blanks in his other six outings; by contrast, Hudson-Odoi has a goal and three assists in 220 minutes of action since returning from injury.
